Module ntnu.idatt1002
Package ntnu.idatt1002.dao

Class UserDAO

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt1002.dao.UserDAO
public final class UserDAO
extends java.lang.Object
The class UserDAO provides static methods for handling User objects. In the storage system each user is saved as folders inside the 'resources/saves/' directory. Inside each user folder the User object gets serialized, along with the directories 'Categories', 'Notifications', 'Projects' and 'Images'.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserDAO

      public UserDAO()

  • Method Details

    • list

      public static java.util.ArrayList<User> list()
      Returns an ArrayList of all User's stored.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList.

    • serialize

      public static void serialize​(User user)
      Serialize a User object to storage. The file will be stored under the user folder. If the user is new all necessary directories will be created. It's important that the user's password variable is the hashed version and not the plaintext, since this will be stored in the computers harddrive.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object.

    • deserialize

      public static User deserialize​(java.lang.String username)
      Get a User object from storage with the given username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username.
      Returns:
      a User object, will be null if the user doesn't exist.

    • delete

      public static boolean delete​(java.lang.String username)
      Delete a User from storage with all its contents.
      Parameters:
      username - the username.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if some or all of the files/directories couldn't be deleted, normally since the user doesn't exist.

    • exists

      static boolean exists​(java.lang.String username)
      Check if the given User exists in storage.
      Parameters:
      username - the username.
      Returns:
      true or false.

    • generateSalt

      public static byte[] generateSalt()
      Returns a byte[] to be passed into the hashPassword(String, byte[]) method as salt. This needs to be stored in a User object along with the hashed password for later verification.
      Returns:
      a byte[] with 16 random bytes.

    • hashPassword

      public static java.lang.String hashPassword​(java.lang.String password, byte[] salt)
      Returns a String with the hashed password using the given plaintext and salt. Salt can be generated with the generateSalt() method. This method uses PBKDF2.
      Parameters:
      password - plaintext password.
      salt - salt for a User.
      Returns:
      a String containing the hashed password, or null if an error occured.
